website_summaries.verdict: A slight upgrade in power and capacity from its little sibling, the Shop Fox W1826. The best value for the money.
cons: Some complaints about the quality of the instructions

customer_reviews.title: Zero quality control in shipping
customer_reviews.text: If, like me, you look at the images in products and you see the one where someone got this item looking like it came from a war zone... that's essentially what I got. The only piece that wasn't absolutely bent / warped to hell and back was the motor, which works perfectly (+1 star). Nothing I can't remedy with some support beams, but if it weren't for the impeller/motor working this would be an immediate return & never ordering from the company again.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B

customer_reviews.title: Heavy item , box damaged during shipment
customer_reviews.text: This Shop Fox dust collection system is awesome. Runs quiet, good powder coated surface, and reasonable price for what you get. But... the package was probably close to 75 pounds and took a beating by UPS during shipment. Couldn't believe product wasn't damaged. 5 stars for quality of the dust collector. 2 stars on packaging.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Very nice powerful dust collector
customer_reviews.text: Would have had 5 stars but the packaging was busted up and had some pretty bad dents in a few places. Probably from fedex but if the packaging was suitable for something that ships at 108lbs this damage probably wouldnt have happened. I decided to hammer it out and use it instead of replace just cause I need it and dents didnt affect performance and because my location makes it more of a pain to deal with returning somethjng this large. But other than that this thing really sucks! In a good way:) it has some serious power. Loving it for that
customer_reviews.author: Abraham

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I have a small shop, 3 car garage and have had this around a year. Not one problem in it's operation, works great. Now that being said as far as the packaging goes, this is not good at all. I read where other buyers where saying parts where bent and so on. I was lucky I only had one dent in the sheet metal. I just straightened it out and every thing was fine. But the vacuum it's self is great. The bag can be a little cumbersome to put back on. I use three spring clamps to hold the bag in place and then put on the band
customer_reviews.author: Cook's Custom Wood Working

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: This unit arrived severely damaged. It was shipped all in one box weighing over one hundred pounds. The unit should have been shipped in two boxes. One box specifically for the fan/motor unit. The fan motor unit weighs approximately eighty pounds. By adding all the other components to rest on top of it, damage easily occurred. This was quite disappointing as the construction of the Fox unit appeared to be good quality. Did not repurchase because other reviews had the same complaint. Amazon refunded my money with no issues. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It sucks like crazy and the filter traps even MDF and ...
customer_reviews.text: In case you have questions about the filter bag size, it is 2.5 micron. There is conflicting data in the description. The unit was received in short order and very well packaged. Everything was in the box and assembly took about an hour. No issues. Now, does it work? Yes. It sucks like crazy and the filter traps even MDF and sanding dust. This vacuum is also not very loud, although I still suggest the use of hearing protection. Very impressed with the unit. One flaw is that the wheels do not seem to want to pivot making maneuverability very difficult. I will likely buy better wheels and replace. All in all this was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Suxx
customer_reviews.text: Still only using it on a couple of my several power tools. The biggest problem I'm having is finding the properly sized transition fittings. I'm amazed that there seems to be NO standardization of ID and OD sizes even though they are all nominally 4". The machine itself is a good sucker.
customer_reviews.author: Red Dogg

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted to say I've had my dust collector for a year-and-a-half now. So the other day I decided to change the bag and also wanted to look at the top bag filter. I turned her inside out and noticed it was full of sawdust. so I decided to vacuum the sawdust out of the bag and surprisingly it came out very easily the bag looks brand new. so if you get this product in about a year or so you can take the bag put it inside out and Easley clean it by vacuuming it.
customer_reviews.author: Woodworking Mike

customer_reviews.title: No product support
customer_reviews.text: The suction power is great but the house requires ear protection. I called for product support and emailed, no return, therefore that is terrible. I have kept the shop vac in one spot in my level garage and moved it two feet and the wheel broke apart including the ball bearings. Attaching the bag after emptying it is a challenge. I'm reviewing this in hopes that I'll get some support since the other means failed
customer_reviews.author: Sportsurgeon

customer_reviews.title: junk packaging, machine was okay
customer_reviews.text: Even the delivery lady was embarrassed at the sorry state of the box and straps this was shipped in. She spent time searching her truck to make sure no parts had fallen out, since loose parts were literally hanging out of the side of the box. Once everything was accounted for and assembled, this dust collector works just fine. Instructions are outdated, and do not match the machine exactly, but close enough to figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: David Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Planer
customer_reviews.text: Does not keep up with the planer. Constantly jambs at the port where the hose and intake port come together. Seems to have a grate inside the intake port and planer shavings get caught and jamb the collection hose. Would not suggest if you run a planer. My planer is a tabletop Dewalt 12" so it is not a big planer.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Fixing the lower bag for easy one man job!
customer_reviews.text: I've only turned on the machine to test it, but it is certainly powerful...some of the instruction are a little vague with the bolts, but anyone can figure it out. I fixed up my lower bag since I read some reviews prior to purchasing. Go out and get a roll of tape for tyvek or house wrap and put that along the edge of the plastic bag while carefully attaching the strap along the outside of the bag. I only put about 6 or 7 small strips of the tyvek tape around the banding to the plastic bag and was pretty easily able to put the bag on by myself.
customer_reviews.author: Jarid

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: It will cost you quite a bit more to set it up. Don't buy 2.5" gates. You lose way too much power. 4" inch line all the way to the tool and you'll love this too. It's not too loud either considering the power. My friend has a much much more expensive one and he was kind of upset seeing how well this worked compared to the unit he paid twice as much for.
customer_reviews.author: Air

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Product was well packaged and seems well made. Haven't set up the ducting yet so no input on suction power. It did seem a little lower than expected at the fan inlet. The mounting of the dust and filter bag stinks big time. If you have three arms and hands installing them isn't difficult. For us normal humans expect to utter an expletive or two during the process. The casters provided are bad, sticking instead of swiveling half the time.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Snow

customer_reviews.title: Bottom Bag has to be held on with tape to get the strap on.
customer_reviews.text: I just received this item, and have only used it once - seems to be built well and works great. The only reason I did not give it a 5 star is because the bottom bag is plastic and you have to use some tape to hold it on until you get the strap around it. They should be able to provide/engineer some other way to handle this. However, I sent them a message complaining about it, and they did respond quickly. They did indicate that I could purchase a second upper bag which has a pocket to run the strap through, which would make it much easier, but hopefully I won’t be replacing the bag that often.
customer_reviews.author: Nottinghams

customer_reviews.title: Quauity of Product
customer_reviews.text: The product operations as expected and does a good job collecting dust and chips from planer, table saw, and jointer. The only watch out for potential buyers is the lack of quality in the packing material and box. The box looked like it had been through world war III and the light density Styrofoam had allowed the heavy motor to move freely during shipping. The resulting damage was significant to every metal part, dented, scraped, or scuffed. Also the connecting plastic Y for the hose connection was broken. This took time and effort to repair and I feel like I am now the proud owner of a used machine rather than a new machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very well constructed, very efficient
customer_reviews.text: Likes: Packaged well, easy to assemble, mobile base a huge plus, very good suction, with two ports. Dislikes: There should be an easier way attach the band around the lower bag to the separator. I attached the bag with shipping tape to the separator to hold it in place, than attached the band. It's a big bag so not really an issue if your need to empty is infrequent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The product is great, the fulfillment by Amazon was a train wreck.
customer_reviews.text: I would have given the product four stars and the fulfillment 0. The box looked like a bomb had gone off in it. Amazingly, only the hose connecting the blower and the collection bags was damaged, and the manufacturer replaced it free of charge, even though Amazon packed it and shipped it. The packaging was completely inadequate.
customer_reviews.author: John Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great buy and Happy
customer_reviews.text: I am more than pleased with this collector. I, like you, read through reviews to do my due diligence. The one thing that worried me the most was the cheap price vs what I would get. This was a great decision and couldn’t be happier. Advice when changing lower bag. If you use 3 small spring loaded clamps to hold the bag up while you tighten the clamp, it makes it super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Glass

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as my first dust collector, it was time to upgrade from a shop vac. Overall I am very happy with the product. Assembly was very easy, only took about an hour, I've used a few pieces of masking tape to hold the bag in place and that's made it much easier when changing out. Noise level is better than I expected, with my hearing protection on it is no bother so I don't mind leaving it running as I switch from tool to tool. I sm using with just 1 flex hose currently and plan to upgrade top a 6in PVC run with a split soon.
customer_reviews.author: Zac Shelton

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.......
customer_reviews.text: I opened my new Shop Fox 1.5 HP system today to assemble it, what I found were several parts either dented or looking like the part was never finished. The Styrofoam was crunched in several places and there was no manual of any type although if you can't figure out how to put it together you should not play with sharp things. It was easy to assemble although a manual would have given me the part number for what will need replaced due to damage.
customer_reviews.author: Bob R.

customer_reviews.title: Good Price Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Works very well in my small shop. The suction is more than adequate . I did have a part that was damaged and Customer Service took care of it they were excellent ( Thank you Adrian ) 1 phone call and 2 days latter part was delivered .
customer_reviews.author: Roger Biddle

customer_reviews.title: It’ll suck the chrome off a trailer hitch....
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely works as described! Very happy.... I had ordered a competitor device and it was back ordered.... I decided I would give the Shop Fox a try and I’m so happy I did... it took about 30 minutes to assemble and was up and running in under 1hr .... no issues whatsoever!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie and Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Good value, terrible packaging
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviews, my package came badly beat up and when opened revealed several bent parts (not too bad, able to restore them ok) but one completely unusable and essential piece, the separator that sits between the two collector bags. It's irresponsible to ship this machine with such thin packaging when a few cents more styrofoam or air cushions could make this otherwise powerful and highly rated machine a winner. I've written to Shop Fox customer service to get the part replaced and will update this review if I get good service.
customer_reviews.author: S. Segal

customer_reviews.title: Slightly frustrated but pleased
customer_reviews.text: The box shipped without damage. Fairly easy to assemble once I went and purchased a new 6” outlet flange hose clamp (came broken) and the two missing hex nut bolts. Instructions tell you to hand tighten the motor mount bracket to be tightened at a later step, which it never does, make sure to go back to that after its mounted to the base.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good choice for a dust collector
customer_reviews.text: On the whole, this is a good buy. However, the packaging and shipping was poor. The box was flimsy and the strapping was so tight it damaged the tool. The base was dented at one corner (no padding), so required some adjustment with a hammer; the collar between the bags was slightly dented, but still usable; and one of the bag supports was bent at the base, again requiring some work with a hammer. I'm still happy with the product in general.
customer_reviews.author: Frank E. Sadowski Jr.

customer_reviews.title: step up in suction
customer_reviews.text: Assembly and setup was real easy. Directions were easy to read and follow. The only flaw I found for my setup was having the on/off switch in the front of the unit. I have my unit in an enclosed closet and it goes in switch first. I ran wire to an outlet and switched it. Happy woodworker
customer_reviews.author: Bob S.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps shop relatively dust free.
customer_reviews.text: Got this to use with a drum sander. It works great collecting 98% of the dust. Some leaks out around the bottom bag which is extremely difficult to install. Finally figured out that if I rolled over the top of the bag it'd stay on long enough to put the band around it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Piper

customer_reviews.title: Part missing, bad bottom bag design.
customer_reviews.text: Box came with the instructions hanging out of it, holes in the side and I now find the outlet gasket in missing AFTER I’m half way through assembling it. Frustrating. Also, hookup for the bottom bag is just plain stupid design. No way to hold the plastic on to install clamp unless you tape it on first. Should be some kind of hooks and a stronger bag than cheap plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Sam A.

customer_reviews.title: It is noisy, and it does one heck of a good job.  I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and in good condition. It is very well made, very heavy duty construction and materials. It is noisy and it does a heck of a good job. I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Country Boy

customer_reviews.title: Needs a separate circuit
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful little machine. I installed it as a dust ejector instead of a collector. I did need to install a 30 amp circuit for it as the rating plate said it was 16 amps which is the trip point of a 20 amp breaker.
customer_reviews.author: David Buckmaster

customer_reviews.title: perfect warranty service and great product
customer_reviews.text: I got the unit; it works as advertised. I used it for a couple days, then a motor bearing went out. Called tech support and two days later had a warranty replacement on my porch. There are super friendly people at Woodstock ( this one and the former hippy musical escapade!). I'm hoping the bad motor was just a fluke. The engineering is nineteenfiftyish, but good and solid. I would recommend this to anyone looking for an inexpensive dust vac. If you plan to use it to pick up more than dust or shavings you'll need to put in an intermediate canister so that big chunks don't pass through the Shopfox impeller.
customer_reviews.author: WL Rubink

customer_reviews.title: Grate
customer_reviews.text: Really nice grate suction price was be little much for me but it worth it I had the one from harbor freight not worth it glad I found this one
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: The Shop Fox was affordable and is not too tall to fit in my basement shop. It's a bit noisy, but that was not unexpected. It seems to be working very well. Assembly required, but not too hard. I am impressed so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Missing bolts and washers , seems pretty cheap, havent pluged it in yet , manual says 1550 cfm will test that tomorrow when my tester comes in and if not close to 1550 it will be sent back , i will allow a little but not alot
customer_reviews.author: charlie

customer_reviews.title: The 2nd one came in and was perfect, got the unit all set up and I ...
customer_reviews.text: Had to exchange the first one I got. The shipping box was not dented but when I opened the box the bag housing had a huge dent on the rim. The 2nd one came in and was perfect, got the unit all set up and I have no complaints other then a remote would be nice but I think it does come with the two hp motor unit.
customer_reviews.author: The Plants’

customer_reviews.title: Dust Collection Solved
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup and installation. But was totally surprised at how low the noise level is. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth hill

customer_reviews.title: A Good Economical Product
customer_reviews.text: I like the product, but I had to visit a lot of suppliers to get everything I needed to set up my shop.
customer_reviews.author: Dadjim13

customer_reviews.title: There may be better and more powerful systems but for me being a ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a vast improvement over a shop vac hose and duct tape I was using. Some reviews talked about noise, some talked about suction. There may be better and more powerful systems but for me being a beginner and moving up to this it works great. I do find it pleasing to put on noise protection anyway when running my grizzly table saw and the vac at the same time. An excellent vacuum in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: R. L. Vance

customer_reviews.title: mine arrived in perfect condition. Assembly was a breeze
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my woodworking shop. I noticed that other reviews had complained that it arrived damaged/cracked, mine arrived in perfect condition. Assembly was a breeze, and it performs better than I thought it would for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the best pieces of shop equipment I've purchased in recent history
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best pieces of shop equipment I've purchased in recent history. Great suction, small footprint, easy to assemble and well constructed. The only downside is the static buildup can be pretty intense but a simple grounding cable really helps.
customer_reviews.author: Lance C Crummett Jr

customer_reviews.title: Dust Collector
customer_reviews.text: Got the product for a really good price. It was sent to me smashed through shipping the first time, (kind of a heavy box for UPS to handle) but they replaced it free of charge with no hassles. Real easy to put together. Seems to have plenty of suction for what I use it for (just to keep things clean around the shop, not an everyday user). Like how it is on wheels and can easily be moved around from place to place. Motor is fairly quiet and it is nice that it is 120V so I can plug it in anywhere easily.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: so far, very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: very solid construction. fairly easy to assemble powerful suction a bit larger than I expected. pleased so far but have not used it much yet.
customer_reviews.author: Brewer

customer_reviews.title: It rolls I love that it moves freely
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is fantastic. It really keeps the dust down
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: great dust collector for my wood shop
customer_reviews.text: great dust collector for my wood shop. Go for the 2.5 micron bag rather than the one it comes with. You're buying this to protect your lungs, so protect them! Sometimes clogs when I'm vacuuming lathe shavings, but it's easy enough to clear and avoidable by managing how much you vacuum at one time. It's pretty quiet too. Compared to a shop vac type vacuum, much quieter and much more effective. Go for it!
customer_reviews.author: markus666

customer_reviews.title: Works Great in my shop
customer_reviews.text: This unit is easy to setup and install and works great. I purchased one PSI Woodworking D50C 4-Inch by 50-Feet Clear Flexible Dust Collection Hose with the unit, attaching it to two different tools, and the amount of dust and material is almost zero compared to when I ran them without the Shop Fox. I was so happy with the performance and price I purchased one as a gift for my favorite woodworker, my Dad, and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Scooter

customer_reviews.title: Upon delivery the box was pretty beat up
customer_reviews.text: Upon delivery the box was pretty beat up. Luckily the product survived. I think something this heavy should be in a sturdier box. There were no directions for assembly. Good thing my husband is a mechanical genius! All in all, good quality machine and relatively quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: SHOP FOX W1685 1.5-Horsepower 1,280 CFM Dust Collector
customer_reviews.text: I'm not one to write reviews of items unless they leave me with a lasting impression. This is one of these items. From shipping to operation it's been top notch. The assembly is elementary and the operation is very impressive (plenty of CFM). The over all quality of this Dust Collector is excellent!. I'm very glad I made this choice. Charles Reid
customer_reviews.author: Charles M. Reid

customer_reviews.title: shopfox dust collector
customer_reviews.text: Like many reviewers, I did my research and found this collector to be the best one to suit my needs. Amazon delivered it fast and at a good price. I put it together yesterday and found out what some people have talked about. The instructions and the hardware kit don't go together. They call for nuts when you don't need them, and different sizes screws then are in the bag. Just use some common sense, and look at the pictures, and you should do fine. I haven't used it yet, but it seems to really suck.
customer_reviews.author: GSC

customer_reviews.title: Very nice low priced machine
customer_reviews.text: Just received mine this week and I believe this is a real bargain. I've only used it one day but it is a great improvement over my 600 CFM Jet dust collector, and also much quieter. The instructions are pretty weak, but everything went together easily with just a little thinking. It is a very sturdy machine. I just need to try it out with my drum sander and see how well it works with that, on my Unisaw and the Jet 12" jointer/planer dust collection is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M

customer_reviews.title: Kind of noisy but works great
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you have a 20 amp circuit for this thing. I really pulls current as it starts. I first put it on a 20 amp circuit but connected through an outlet with a 15 amp breaker. I thought it would be ok as I had used another device that also had a 1.5 hp motor plugged in to this outlet. But each time I tried to start the dust collector the breaker would go off. So it is now plugged into a dedicated 20 amp circuit.
customer_reviews.author: P Gleason

customer_reviews.title: It's very powerful. Should have bought this instead of ...
customer_reviews.text: It's very powerful. Should have bought this instead of my shopvac.
customer_reviews.author: jose palacios

customer_reviews.title: Works great easy to use and assemble
customer_reviews.text: All parts there needed to assemble but box was very badly damaged one metal part damaged pretty good was able to make it work.works great easy to Assemble suction power really great carrier at fault for shipping damages not rockler
customer_reviews.author: Jon Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I am really impressed with this unit. It has a great suction and pulls so much more than my shop vac. It probably captures 90% of the dust from my table saw. I did upgrade to 1 micron bags. The 30 micron bags that come with it let way too much through. It was kind of a pain to put together but after that, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Elmira217

customer_reviews.title: Works Great but Poor Fasteners
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made machine. But, I have to echo what others have said. The screws that come with it are poor. Plan on making a trip to Home Depot for some replacement nuts or screws. Once its assembled, it works great. I teamed it with a Big Horn 11141 Cyclone Separator, 30 Gallon and I highly recommend that you get one of these to keep the dust from making it to your Shop Fox.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Swaim

customer_reviews.title: Check product after receiving.....carriers are prone to damage unit during shipment.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome dust collection and twice as powerful for comparable priced products.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: ... has died in 2 months- the filter bag was horrible as well
customer_reviews.text: Hooked up to my Striebig panel saw and has died in 2 months- the filter bag was horrible as well. At least Harbor Freight's 2 HP lasted 2 years!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Lundin

customer_reviews.title: SYHOP FOX Dust5 Collector Does The Job Right!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the Bomb for my shop! I had no idea what clean air was until I installed this baby! This is my first piece of SHOP FOX equipment I've introduced into my wood shop, but based upon performance.... the next time I need equipment I will start with SHOP FOX.
customer_reviews.author: Mikie

customer_reviews.title: Performs to my expectations
customer_reviews.text: My Shop Fox W1685 was easily installed although the dust collector had been upgraded but the assembly instructions had not. Had to call the shop fox tech line to learn that although the instructions said I needed several screws that were not included, actually I had enough to assemble the unit. The tech person was very helpful. The unit performs to my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm C. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to put together, and it works as it should. It's not made of cheap, flimsy metal like from the discount tool stores, I imagine I'll get a lot of use out of this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product !
customer_reviews.text: This product works amazing. We have it hooked up in our shop to a Bosh table saw and a dewalt 12" chop saw. With both of them running and cutting material simultaneously this dust collector does not hesitate to suck up the wood or aluminum chips.!!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Amazon purchase these in bulk and has been stocking them. Manufacturer will not warranty
customer_reviews.text: Both arrived severely damaged and missing parts. Metal ring was so crumpled it was not getting achieving maximum collection. Blowing dust all over
customer_reviews.author: christian smith

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup; works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup; works perfectly. Since I only use one machine at a time it collects the dust from my table saw; band saw, Dewalt 735 Planer, and jointer without a hitch.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Van Brunt

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of air flow to move the dust. Very sturdy construction and easy to assemble. The manual is (like most printed manuals these days) prone to errors and can be confusing, but the design makes it simple to assemble anyway. Typical Shopfox product; good stuff. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: James May

customer_reviews.title: Great dust collector
customer_reviews.text: This is a great dust collector system, is assemble very easy and quickly and dose the job that it designed to do. I read one of the reviews that someone wrote and only rated it a 4 star because the ad said that it was white but was a beige. To someone that is woodworking and trying to control dust the color of the product doesn't even matter. This is a great dust control system, Amazon and Shop Fox great job.
customer_reviews.author: Darnell Collums

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. So nice not to have so much saw dust flying everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: No instructions!
customer_reviews.text: Assembly is mostly common-sense but there are a few places where instructions would have helped a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: has plenty of power
customer_reviews.text: Its done a great job easy to put together I'M in a wheel chair and it took me about 1 1/2 hours by myself the motor is very heavy.
customer_reviews.author: planecrazy540

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Package received was broken open and parts were hanging out. When I put it together, all parts were there, however, a couple of the parts were dented. Instructions for assembly were acceptable. The paint on the motor was peeling off; there was a dent in the side of the separator; it took two people to help in installing the collection bag and it still leaks; and instructions for the filter bag was vague. The performance of the unit is acceptable, however, with these problems (and this isn't the first Shop Fox that I purchased that had problems similarly) I would suggest going with a higher price, more well known brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: shop fox
customer_reviews.text: this unit rocks....very little clean up of cnc router after doing heavy carving. the casters on it are terrible so i would replace those, but overall does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis DuBois

customer_reviews.title: Dollar for dollar unbelievable
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat this for the money. Takes care of my wood shop
customer_reviews.author: robert s.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: used for over a year with no problems worked great
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: excellent power. Quite loud
customer_reviews.text: Works well, excellent power. Quite loud, and the included bag is completely inadequate at 30 microns, but I knew that when I purchased it. Put an after market 5 micron bag on, and it does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: briann188

customer_reviews.title: efficient dust collector
customer_reviews.text: I bought this dust collector after a shop project created a tremendous amount of saw dust. I put off buying one for years but the wait was worth it. This unit is cost effective, does a great job, well built, easy to assemble and is relatively quiet.
customer_reviews.author: J. Conway

customer_reviews.title: Shop Fox Dust Collector
customer_reviews.text: Nothing really negative about the actual machine. Packaging could have been a little better. Major dent in middle component but covered by lower bag. Work perfectly. Keep your hands away for the inlet. Has much more vacuum than my other one.
customer_reviews.author: JDUZ

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this dust collector. It more than meets my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: have a small shop and this sucks the paint off the walls
customer_reviews.text: have a small shop and this sucks the paint off the walls. a bit loud but worth the ear protection
customer_reviews.author: Ter

customer_reviews.title: Great Suction, seems well built
customer_reviews.text: I'm a pretty amateur woodworker, so dont get a TON of everyday use out of this, but when its hooked up right, it sucks like nobody's business. No issues after over a year.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great for a small shop, and much quieter than a shop vac
customer_reviews.author: Brian F Ronan

customer_reviews.title: Just right for my shop
customer_reviews.text: It does what I bought it to do! I would recommend it to any body. It does draw considerable power on start up
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Schmitz

customer_reviews.title: This thing SUCKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: With 1280cfm this thing has a lot of sucking power. I connected a dust deputy up to it and my shop has been clean for a while now. One important thing to keep in mind is that this unit pulls 16amps on 110v. You will need to plug into a 20amp circuit for best results. This is a great product at a very good price.
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: shop fox
customer_reviews.text: this is a more powerful system than I expected and I am very pleased with it. if critical thing can be said, it is somewhat noisy.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Dust collector #7,  1.5 hp Shop Fox
customer_reviews.text: I have four Delta 1.5 hp collectors and two older 3 hp 3phase collectors in my shop. The new unt was purchased to collect from a 24" drum sander (only). The specs say it is the same CFM as the 1.5hp Deltas but the one connecting pipe from the fan to the bags is 5" not 6" as on the Delta. That said, the unit was delivered w/o damage. Assembly was easy. The collector is quiet and works just fine. Lastly, the price was right. As a dedicated unit I think it is a perfect choice. Go for it, stop eating all of that dust.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: I'm just unpacking my Shop Fox and there is damage ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm just unpacking my Shop Fox and there is damage to the edge of the cowling where the dust bags attach. How can I get this replaced?
customer_reviews.author: Jerome A Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great dust collector
customer_reviews.text: It does what I bought it to do! I would recommend it to any body. It does draw considerable power on start up.
customer_reviews.author: Tcart driver

customer_reviews.title: Dust Collector
customer_reviews.text: This product was just what I was looking for and at a great price. Great people/ company to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hamlin

customer_reviews.title: This is a Super Duper Sucker.
customer_reviews.text: My first dust collector for my shop and glad I picked the Shop Fox...does a great job...I highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Patterson

customer_reviews.title: My original dust evacuation was very pathetic. The Shop Fox has definitely eliminated a vast ...
customer_reviews.text: My original dust evacuation was very pathetic. The Shop Fox has definitely eliminated a vast majority of the dust, but I know it's not as good as a $2000.00 model. That being said, I'm very pleased with the Shop Fox for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Patton

customer_reviews.title: need ear protection if unit in same room Very difficult to clean filter bag and even harder to re-install (takes two persons) Th
customer_reviews.text: Blower noise level high, need ear protection if unit in same room Very difficult to clean filter bag and even harder to re-install (takes two persons) The upper filter bag rod is flimsy and wobbly (cheap and poor design) Intake port of blower easy clogged by 6 inch joiner wood strands
customer_reviews.author: Crow

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome dust collector for the price! 3rd one in my shop!
customer_reviews.author: christian

customer_reviews.title: Shopfox W1685
customer_reviews.text: Very power full machine ,took the woodchips out of my two stage system and cleaned out all the old chips that were stuck in the pipes ,plenty of power
customer_reviews.author: John M Kegler

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like the product and is very helpful in keeping the shop clean.
customer_reviews.author: David Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Easy directions
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Easy directions. Outstanding service provided by Amazon. The item was badly damaged during shipment. Amazon immediately sent a new replacement and provided an easy to follow procedure to return the damaged item.
customer_reviews.author: Gift Card Recipient

customer_reviews.title: As good as the much higher priced items
customer_reviews.text: This machine is everything the reviews said it would be.
customer_reviews.author: JCal

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if we got a defective unit or what
customer_reviews.text: This thing is very very powerful... However it is also extremely loud. It sounds like 10 shop vacs running at once. Amazon was great about letting us return it, but we weren't going to try another one. I want to think we had a bad one b/c no one would tolerate a product this noisy even outside.
customer_reviews.author: Gentle_Ben

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control Problems
customer_reviews.text: Just opened the box, step on on assembly is to insert 16 bolts into the 16 holes in the base, but the holes are very much too small. I bought this device because it got good reviews, but my starting point suggests that quality control for shop fox is a problem..... i am going to try a hardware store to see if i can find bolts that fit, but this is highly annoying.... color me extremely disappointed, and I haven't even put the product together.... also, a separate issue is that the box arrived damaged.......
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Davis

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, if you like cracked/damaged things
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my first vacuum, the box seemed okay, no visible dents. I opened the box and it looked like someone dropped the collar with the 4" port. (Not sure what it's technically called). Ordered a replacement.....box seemed fine. Opened it completely and found the exact same problem. Another cracked/dented collar. How does this leave the factory this way??
customer_reviews.author: James R. Kracus

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Easy to assemble. Glad that I bought it
customer_reviews.author: pops323

customer_reviews.title: shopfox dust collector
customer_reviews.text: Mixed reviews on this unit. Just opened the box and found two of the three uprights for the bag broken. The welds were very cheaply done. One was broken completely and the other was badly cracked. After construction I plugged the motor into a 20 amp plug strip and it wouldn't get out of the startup speed without the motor's thermal overload kicking out. I plugged it into a wall outlet and it begrudginly started. Hopefully I won't be having more trouble with that. Looking forward to getting to use it. Chiz in Indiana
customer_reviews.author: chiz

customer_reviews.title: There were a couple of minor parts missing and they were easily replaceable. The casters are junk
customer_reviews.text: It arrived and was packaged well. The problems occurred after I started to assemble it. There were no instructions. There were a couple of minor parts missing and they were easily replaceable. The casters are junk. They lock up and just skid when you try to move the machine. I finally had to buy some quality casters and now it rolls fine. It seems to perform well and should be a nice addition to my shop.
customer_reviews.author: MJT

product_meta.title: SHOP FOX W1685 1.5-Horsepower 1,280 CFM Dust Collector
product_meta.description: Style:1.5 HP, 1,280 CFMA powerful dust collector from Shop Fox. This unit features an extra heavy-duty 12" steel impeller and a 1-1/2 HP motor that runs on 110V. For wood dust only. Features 2.5 micron filtration.

specifications.Special Features: Powder coated paint, Air suction capacity: Approx. 1,280 CFM, Impeller: Balanced steel, radial fin 12", 6" inlet with a removable "Y" fitting with two 4" openings, Static pressure: 10.1", Standard bag filtration: 2.5 Micron
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars217 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
